claims.claim: Ex-offenders face discrimination in employment applications.
claims.quote: every time you fill out an application and they see that you are an ex-offender, they say, well, we don't hire ex-offenders.

claims.claim: Society benefits from forgiving and rehabilitating offenders.
claims.quote: if somebody has done wrong and you call yourself a Christian society, then where's forgiveness come in at

claims.claim: Ex-offenders contribute positively to society post-release through service.
claims.quote: I was already building the prison ministry. I've been doing this for years. I did it inside a prison and I'm doing it outside

claims.claim: People with criminal records can effectively work in educational roles.
claims.quote: I worked for Urban Prep Academy ... as a counselor. I have a master's degree in communication.

claims.claim: Formerly incarcerated individuals are crucial in reaching and positively influencing at-risk youth.
claims.quote: These young brothers had so much respect for me because they understood what I came from. I knew how to communicate with them. I knew how to talk to them because I came out of the very same streets that they are in right now.

claims.claim: Ex-offenders are unfairly terminated from jobs due to their criminal record despite performance.
claims.quote: it finally appeared ... He said, but because the effect that you had in this school on these young men, he said, I might let you go on paper, but you can still volunteer and I'll pay you under the table.

claims.claim: Educational achievements are possible inside prisons.
claims.quote: What you thought I did sit down and do nothing. I studied and went to school and worked every day.
